description: From Middle English prohibitif, prohibityve, from Medieval Latin prohibitīvus, from prohibit-, past-participle stem of Latin prohibēre.

adjectives.description: prohibitive (comparative more prohibitive, superlative most prohibitive)

entries.meaning: Tending to prohibit, preclude, or disallow.
examples: Some countries are more prohibitive than others when it comes to hot topics like euthanasia and cloning.

entries.meaning: Costly to the extreme; beyond budget.
examples: I'd like to visit Europe someday, but the cost is prohibitive right now.

entries.meaning: (Of a contender in a competition): presumptive winner, likely winner.
